EVOLUTION.Definition: the way they changed and improved over time

PROTAGONIST.Definition: the main character or person in the story

LOAF.Definition: a quantity of bread that is shaped and baked in one piece

SENTENCED.Definition: given a punishment by a court

SENTENCE.Definition: the punishment given by a court

FICTIONAL.Definition: made-up or not real, from a story

SHILLING.Definition: an old british coin used as money

HARSHLY.Definition: in a very strict or cruel way

ADULTERY.Definition: being unfaithful to a husband or wife

WITCHCRAFT.Definition: the practice of magic, especially for evil purposes

HOMOSEXUALITY.Definition: romantic or sexual attraction to the same gender

TRIAL.Definition: a process to decide if someone was guilty or innocent

DROWN.Definition: die by being underwater and unable to breathe

IMMUNE SYSTEMS.Definition: complex networks of organs, cells and proteins that defend the body against infection

RULINGS.Definition: decisions made by a court or authority

TRIAL BY JURY.Definition: a legal process where a group of people decided if someone was guilty

MAGISTRATE.Definition: a type of judge in charge of smaller legal matters

JURIES.Definition: groups of people chosen to decide the result of a trial

JURY.Definition: a group of people who decide if someone is guilty in court

WEIGHING UP.Definition: thinking carefully about it before making a decision

EYE-WITNESSES.Definition: people who had seen something happen with their own eyes

BIAS.Definition: a preference that made it unfair

TREASON.Definition: the crime of betraying one’s country

HERESY.Definition: having beliefs that went against the accepted religion

BEHEADING.Definition: cutting off someone’s head as a punishment

STAKE.Definition: a wooden post where people were tied to and burned as punishment

DARED.Definition: had the courage or took the risk

WHIPPING.Definition: hitting someone with a long rope as punishment

BRANDING.Definition: burning a mark onto someone’s skin as punishment

BEGGING.Definition: asking for money or food on the streets

FLOGGED.Definition: beaten with a whip or stick

RAPE.Definition: forcing someone to have sex without their permission

GYPSIES.Definition: a group of people who traditionally travelled from place to place

PUTTING ONE FOOT WRONG.Definition: making a mistake or doing something bad

UPSTANDING.Definition: behaving in a moral or honest way

DETERRENT.Definition: something that would stop people from doing something bad

GALLOWS.Definition: a structure used to hang people as punishment

THINK TWICE.Definition: stop and think carefully before acting

FOLK HEROES.Definition: people admired by common people for their bravery

CRUELTY.Definition: causing pain on purpose or severity

PETTY THEFT.Definition: stealing something small or not valuable

NOOSE.Definition: ​a circle that was tied in one end of a rope used to hang people

PARDON.Definition: forgiveness of a crime, no punishment

RADICAL.Definition: very new and different from the usual

GROUNDWORK.Definition: basic work needed for something bigger

SPEAK OUT AGAINST.Definition: publicly say they disagreed with it

PENAL COLONIES.Definition: places where criminals were sent to live away from society

IN ITS OWN RIGHT.Definition: because of its own special qualities and not because of a connection with something else

REHABILITATION.Definition: helping someone recover and return to a normal life

PENITENCE.Definition: feeling sorry for doing something wrong

SOLITARY CONFINEMENT.Definition: being kept alone in a cell as punishment

OVERCROWDING.Definition: having too many people in one space

ROBBED.Definition: took property unlawfully from, stole from
